page.title: 02SHOPPING
page.content: People shop in the village for food and groceres, and news-papers in the village shops. There are three shops. The post-office which is also a general store and a news-agents, a butcher and a grocers. To buy clothes and shoes and other things that we do not need so often, people go to Oundle, Peterborough, Kettering, Corby, Northampton and even London. Some show rooms sell only one sort of thing, like electric cookers or cars. Some people use catalogues instead of going out to the shops. They order by post. Some people order by telephone for goods advertised on television. Sometimes people come to the door to sell things. Written by Teresa Briggs
